text.name: sys_description
text.text: In 1988 released the CD-ROM² System (1.0 and 2.0). This extension allows to add a CD player to the PCE, a new BIOS and 64 KB of memory. In 1991, released the Super CD-ROM² System (3.0) which accelerates the reader, changes BIOS and adds 256 KB of memory. The all-in-one version comes out under the name of PC-Engine Duo, or TurboDuo. The Duo-R and RX are just redesigned versions. The Arcade CD-ROM² comes out in 1994, in the form of a U-Card and expands the memory to 2 MB. Only twenty games will be released on this evolution. These memory additions benefit all games.
